page.title: 01IPSWICH'S "RURBAN" FRINGE.
page.content: Directly north of the centre of the Suffolk town of Ipswich lise 12 square kilometres of rural-urban (rurban) fringe. Most of the landscape is open land with farmland and open spaces. The area has two small villages - {WESTERFIELD {and {TUDDENHAM} and some of {Ipswich's} outer housing estates. The main railway line from Ipswich to Lowestoft and Felixstowe passes through the area. One major road crosses part of the area, but most of the roads are quiet country lanes, leading to farms and country houses. It is undulating land with two small rivers, one flowing to the River Deben and one to the River Gipping.
